page.title: 12EASTERFORD MILL
page.content: In the first Domesday Book there was a Mill recorded on the site where Easterford Mill stands in 1985. Easterford Mill was built around 1750 and enlarged in 1812. Mr Robert Starling,who was a previous owner, shut the gates, the water flooded back towards Coggeshall Road he was found guilty of doing the flooding.Mr Rogers owned the Mill in 1930 and was the last person to grind corn.The Mill has 3 grinding stones,the Mill also has an 11 foot water wheel and 7 foot paddles. They had a place to go when they wanted a break somebody has engraved his name in the floor.The top floor is called the Bin Floor and is used for storing corn. When the corn is coming down the chute to make it come down slower there is something called a Chattering Female.
